meanings.definition: Serving as a temporary or interim measure.
meanings.sent1: The provisionary solution helped us until we found a permanent fix.
meanings.sent2: Her provisionary plan was to use a borrowed laptop until hers was fixed.
meanings.sent3: The provisionary umbrella made of plastic bags kept him dry in the sudden rain.
meanings.sent4: The provisionary bridge made of wooden planks swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The provisionary shelter made of cardboard boxes provided some relief from the cold.

meanings.definition: Contingent upon certain conditions being met.
meanings.sent1: The agreement was provisionary until all parties signed the contract.
meanings.sent2: His provisionary offer depended on the completion of the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The provisionary party invitation required guests to wear costumes.
meanings.sent4: Her provisionary promise hinged on receiving approval from her parents.
meanings.sent5: The provisionary scholarship required a minimum GPA to be maintained.
